import React, {useState} from "react" import { AppContext } from "../appProvider" import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid' import { isCompositeComponent } from "react-dom/test-utils" function Camping() { const contextItems = React.useContext(AppContext) const [selects, setSelects] = React.useState([]) const [eachState, setEachState] = React.useState([]) // MAY NEED TO PASS IN KEY FOR EACH MAPPED DIV ON LINE 11 function clearState(){ setEachState([]) } //THIS MAPS THROUGH EVERY RECALL ITEM IN THE CONTEXT ARRAY function showList() { clearState() const list = contextItems.recalls.map(thing => { if(thing.state === selects) { setEachState(prevState => [...prevState, thing] ) } } ) console.log(eachState) } // LINES 34 -45 ARE BUTTON LOGIC TO DISPLAY SPECIFIC STATES const wa = contextItems.recalls.filter((item) => { if (item.state === "WA") return ( true ) }) function waList(){ for(let i = 0; i < wa.length; i++){ console.log(wa[i].city) } } const stateList = eachState.map(thing =>

Location:

{thing.city}, {thing.state}. {thing.country}

Product Type:

{thing.product_type}

Product Description:

{thing.product_description}

Reason for Recall:

{thing.reason_for_recall}
) return ( <>

Use our free search tool to see campsites in your state.

Select your state from the drop-down menu below.





{stateList}
) } export default Camping
